31|./esg_report/TAISUN_ENTERPRISE.pdf|3. Risk	Management

In 2022, our company’s ESG Sustainable Development Committee launched a “TCFD Climate Change-related Financial Disclosure” 

survey. They convened relevant members in meetings to jointly assess potential risks the company may face due to climate change, 

identifying risk sources, conducting risk analysis and assessment, and addressing risks to continuously reduce impact. They discussed 

and identified transition risks (policy and regulations, technology, market, reputation), physical risks (immediate risks, long-term risks), 

and opportunities (resource efficiency, energy sources, products/services, market, resilience). Considering the time frame, the assessment 

intervals are short-term (1-3 years), medium-term (3-5 years), and long-term (over 5 years). The top 10 in each interval are prioritized, 

with short-term risks addressed first. Medium and long-term risks are evaluated based on company resources. Annual reviews of 

strategic actions assess the effectiveness of target implementation. If necessary, risk discussions and identification are conducted again.", "page|source|page_content

Materiality Management Identification Process

Identification 
Process

The compilation of the 2023 ESG Sustainability Report, based on stakeholder inclusiveness, 

responsiveness, impact, and sustainability perspectives, identified seven major stakeholders, same as 

the previous ESG Sustainability Report. Additionally, 25 issues were identified based on food industry-related regulations. After interacting 

with stakeholders and discussions with the ESG Sustainability Development Committee and experts 

about positive, negative, and actual potential impacts (recorded in meeting minutes), 11 material issues 

were analyzed for this year’s report. These serve as the focus of the 2023 report, with other issues 

voluntarily disclosed based on key food industry situations. The report will explain the management 

approach and related disclosure items for each material topic. ESG Work Strategy

Organizational Structure

While pursuing maximum profits, Taisun also actively considers how to reduce the negative environmental impact of economic activities 

and expand its influence to implement corporate social responsibility, creating sustainable operational value. In 2023, in the face of global supply chain issues, the prolonged Russia-Ukraine conflict leading to an international energy crisis, and 

significant increases in raw material prices, Taisun implemented flexible supply chain scheduling to reduce negative impacts on business 

operations. In supplier management, in addition to regular supplier evaluations, Taisun continued to implement the signing of the 

“Integrity and Sustainable Development Commitment” by suppliers, ensuring the strictest quality and safety controls for vendors and

methods already under consideration. Once certain projects are completed and operational, it is estimated that Taisun will make

The Chairman serves as the Chief Commissioner of the ESG Sustainability 

Development Committee. Committee members include the General 

Manager, first-level supervisors under the jurisdiction, and the 

spokesperson. They supervise and manage the goals, results, commitments, 

and planning of sustainable operations and social responsibility, fulfilling 

long-term commitments to stakeholders while disclosing information to the 

public and conducting internal audits. The ESG Responsibility Office is responsible for coordinating and 

implementing related ESG strategic goal plans and actions. It regularly holds 

meetings to assist the committee in ensuring various commitments are 

completed on schedule, grasps communication information from relevant 

stakeholders in various departments, and regularly discloses work results. The four major groups-corporate governance, health assurance, 

environmental sustainability, and corporate commitment-all report 

department work overviews through regular management meetings held by 

the Responsibility Office. They regularly report to the ESG Sustainability 

Development Committee for guidance.", "page|source|page_content

The detailed opinion is provided in Appendix VI. This report’s content structure follows the GRI Standards published 

by the Global Sustainability Standards Board (GSSB), using GRI 

Universal Standards and Topic-specific Standards for reporting. It 

also references the Taiwan Stock Exchange Corporation’s “Rules 

Governing the Preparation and Filing of Sustainability Reports by TWSE

response:
The ESG report from Taisun Enterprise adheres to several internationally recognized frameworks, which include the Global Reporting Initiative (GRI), the Sustainability Accounting Standards Board (SASB), and the Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD). These frameworks provide structured guidelines for sustainability reporting and are widely accepted in the field of corporate social responsibility. 

The report states that it has been compiled in accordance with the GRI Standards, particularly referencing the GRI Universal Standards and the topic-specific standards relevant to the food industry. Furthermore, it refers to the SASB standards for processed foods and aligns with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The TCFD framework is also utilized for reporting climate-related information, which is crucial for assessing the company's financial disclosures related to climate risks and opportunities.

In terms of alignment, Taisun's report appears to be comprehensive, covering various aspects required by these frameworks. For instance, it includes sections on governance, risk management, and specific sustainability performance indicators, which are essential components of the GRI and SASB standards. Additionally, the report outlines the company's approach to climate change risks and opportunities in detail, in accordance with TCFD recommendations. 

Overall, Taisun's commitment to these frameworks reflects an intention to enhance transparency and accountability in its sustainability practices, providing stakeholders with a clear understanding of its environmental, social, and governance strategies. The report aims to fulfill the requirements of these frameworks while also addressing the specific challenges and opportunities faced by the food industry.
reference:
### **Frameworks Followed in the ESG Report**

The 2023 ESG Sustainability Report of **Taisun Enterprise Co., Ltd.** aligns with several internationally recognized frameworks to ensure thorough and standardized sustainability disclosures. The report emphasizes its adherence to the following frameworks:

1. **Global Reporting Initiative (GRI):**
   - The report follows the GRI Standards, a globally recognized framework that prioritizes materiality in sustainability reporting. The company uses GRI Universal Standards alongside topic-specific standards to address critical ESG dimensions comprehensively. Additionally, Appendix I includes a GRI Standards Index for detailed disclosure mapping.

2. **Sustainability Accounting Standards Board (SASB):**
   - Taisun incorporates the SASB standards for the "Processed Foods" sector, ensuring that its sustainability disclosures align with investor-focused criteria and industry-specific material issues. Appendix II provides a SASB Processed Foods Sustainability Accounting Standards Index.

3. **Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD):**
   - Taisun integrates the TCFD framework into its climate-related disclosures, focusing on governance, strategy, risk management, and metrics. This demonstrates the company's commitment to addressing climate change's financial impacts.

4. **United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs):**
   - The report references the SDGs to align its sustainability initiatives with global development priorities. Appendix III outlines the company's work related to specific SDGs.

5. **Taiwan Stock Exchange Guidelines:**
   - The report complies with the "Rules Governing the Preparation and Filing of Sustainability Reports by TWSE Listed Companies" and the "Sustainable Development Best Practice Principles for TWSE/TPEx Listed Companies."

6. **ISO Standards:**
   - Taisun adheres to ISO frameworks such as ISO 45001 (Occupational Health and Safety Management) and ISO/IEC 17025 (Laboratory Testing).

7. **Third-party Assurance:**
   - Ernst & Young conducted a limited assurance of the report under the Assurance Standard No. 3000, enhancing its credibility.

---

### **Alignment and Evaluation**

Taisun's report demonstrates a strong alignment with these frameworks, showcasing its dedication to maintaining global standards in ESG reporting:

1. **GRI Alignment:**
   - The report effectively utilizes the GRI materiality approach to address stakeholder concerns and key ESG topics, including governance, environmental impacts, and social responsibility. This alignment ensures the comprehensiveness of disclosures.

2. **SASB Implementation:**
   - The inclusion of SASB standards highlights Taisun's focus on industry-specific metrics, particularly for the processed food sector, making the report relevant to investors.

3. **TCFD Integration:**
   - The TCFD framework is well-implemented, with detailed discussions on climate risks and opportunities, renewable energy projects, and carbon management strategies, reflecting a robust approach to addressing climate change.

4. **SDG Mapping:**
   - While the report references SDGs, the specific contributions to individual goals could be more detailed, providing stakeholders with a clearer understanding of the company's impact.

5. **ISO and Compliance Standards:**
   - By adhering to ISO and TWSE guidelines, the report ensures reliability and compliance with local and international expectations.

6. **Assurance Process:**
   - The external assurance by Ernst & Young validates the report's accuracy and reliability, reinforcing stakeholder confidence.

---

### **Strengths and Areas for Improvement**

**Strengths:**
   - Comprehensive adherence to internationally recognized frameworks (GRI, SASB, TCFD).
   - Strong alignment with Taiwan Stock Exchange sustainability guidelines.
   - Third-party assurance enhances the report's credibility.
   - Effective use of TCFD for climate-related disclosures.

**Areas for Improvement:**
   - The report could provide more granular details on how Taisun's initiatives align with individual SDGs.
   - While robust, the materiality assessment process could include clearer stakeholder feedback mapping for better transparency.

In conclusion, Taisun Enterprise's ESG report reflects a well-structured and framework-compliant approach, emphasizing its commitment to sustainability and corporate responsibility. Further refinement in SDG mapping and materiality transparency can elevate its reporting standards to exemplary levels.

user_input: Is the organizational scope and time frame of the report clearly defined? Does it specify the parts of the company (e.g., subsidiaries, supply chains) included in the report?
response:
I don't have access to any specific data sources to evaluate the organizational scope or time frame of the report you are referring to. Therefore, I'm unable to determine whether the report clearly defines these aspects or specifies the parts of the company included, such as subsidiaries or supply chains.

For a comprehensive assessment, you would typically look for sections in the report that outline its scope, methodology, and any limitations. These sections often provide details on what parts of the organization are covered, the time period of the data presented, and any relevant exclusions. If you have specific excerpts or information from the report, I could help you analyze that further.
reference:
### **Organizational Scope and Time Frame of the Report**

The 2023 ESG Sustainability Report of **Taisun Enterprise Co., Ltd.** clearly defines its organizational scope and time frame, ensuring transparency and clarity for stakeholders. These aspects are integral to the report's structure, as outlined below:

#### **Time Frame**
- The report discloses information covering the period from **January 1 to December 31, 2023**. 
- It also incorporates some social content that extends before and after the specified period, with relevant numerical explanations and calculation formulas provided as notes. This approach ensures that the report captures both current and transitional aspects of the company's operations.

#### **Organizational Scope**
- The reports boundaries include Taisun Enterprise Co., Ltd. (referred to as Taisun) and its subsidiaries, focusing on operational activities within Taiwan.
- The report explicitly includes data from:
  - **Pin-Tai Distribution Enterprise Co., Ltd.**, a subsidiary responsible for sales and distribution.
  - **Taisun Cultural Foundation**, a non-profit unit promoting education and culture.
- For food safety and environmental management, the report covers Taisuns core facilities:
  - **Tianzhong Food Plant**
  - **Tianzhong Oil Plant**
  - **Taisun Aqua Feed Plant**
  - **Beidou Ranch**
- Food production-related disclosures are limited to **consumer food products bearing the Taisun logo**, excluding OEM and feed products.

#### **Key Notes on Scope**
- The report acknowledges discrepancies between the financial data presented and the financial statements, clarifying that:
  - Financial figures are based on individual data from Taisun rather than consolidated figures.
  - ESG-related information from subsidiaries is not fully synchronized, emphasizing the focus on Taisuns standalone performance.

#### **Supply Chain Inclusion**
- The report provides insights into supply chain management, particularly in areas such as supplier evaluations and the signing of the "Integrity and Sustainable Development Commitment" by vendors. However, the operational details of suppliers or external stakeholders are referenced only within the context of Taisun's direct influence.

---

### **Evaluation of Scope Definition**

The organizational scope and time frame are well-articulated in the report, providing stakeholders with a comprehensive understanding of what is included:

1. **Strengths:**
   - The report includes specific plants and subsidiaries, ensuring clarity in operational boundaries.
   - The inclusion of both standalone and subsidiary-level performance highlights transparency.
   - Coverage of consumer products while excluding OEM products reflects a focused disclosure strategy.
   
2. **Areas for Improvement:**
   - While supply chain management is discussed, the inclusion of more granular data on upstream and downstream supply chain impacts could strengthen the report's comprehensiveness.
   - Synchronization of ESG data between Taisun and its subsidiaries would enhance reporting consistency.

In conclusion, Taisun Enterprise's ESG Sustainability Report effectively defines its organizational scope and time frame, providing stakeholders with clarity on its ESG performance. Refining supply chain disclosures and aligning subsidiary ESG data with the parent company's framework would further enhance the report's value.

In 2022, our company’s ESG Sustainable Development Committee launched a “TCFD Climate Change-related Financial Disclosure” 

survey. They convened relevant members in meetings to jointly assess potential risks the company may face due to climate change, 

identifying risk sources, conducting risk analysis and assessment, and addressing risks to continuously reduce impact. They discussed 

and identified transition risks (policy and regulations, technology, market, reputation), physical risks (immediate risks, long-term risks), 

and opportunities (resource efficiency, energy sources, products/services, market, resilience). Considering the time frame, the assessment 

intervals are short-term (1-3 years), medium-term (3-5 years), and long-term (over 5 years). The top 10 in each interval are prioritized, 

with short-term risks addressed first. Medium and long-term risks are evaluated based on company resources. Annual reviews of 

strategic actions assess the effectiveness of target implementation. If necessary, risk discussions and identification are conducted again.", "page|source|page_content
3|./esg_report/TAISUN_ENTERPRISE.pdf|We expect to create outstanding results through everyone’s

Materiality Management Identification Process

Identification 
Process

The compilation of the 2023 ESG Sustainability Report, based on stakeholder inclusiveness, 

responsiveness, impact, and sustainability perspectives, identified seven major stakeholders, same as 

the previous ESG Sustainability Report. Additionally, 25 issues were identified based on food industry-related regulations. After interacting 

with stakeholders and discussions with the ESG Sustainability Development Committee and experts 

about positive, negative, and actual potential impacts (recorded in meeting minutes), 11 material issues 

were analyzed for this year’s report. These serve as the focus of the 2023 report, with other issues 

voluntarily disclosed based on key food industry situations. The report will explain the management 

approach and related disclosure items for each material topic. ESG Work Strategy

Ethical Management

Importance to 
the Company

Establishing a corporate culture of integrity management helps the company’s healthy 
development, consolidates a good business operational framework, and protects the 
rights and interests of all stakeholders. Policy 
Commitment

Short-Term 
Goals

The Board of Directors has approved the “Ethical Corporate Management Best Practice 
Principles” and the “Procedures for Ethical Development and Guidelines for Conduct,” 
which are implemented by all Board members and employees. The company is committed 
to operating all business activities with integrity management principles, striving for the 
best operational performance. •      Ensure 100% of new suppliers with transactions exceeding TWD 100,000 sign the 

"Integrity and Sustainable Development Commitment."

•     Continue to conduct educational training and awareness programs for all Board 

members and employees regarding relevant laws and regulations. •     Enhance information transparency. Mid-and Long-
Term Goals

•     Expand corporate influence and continue to promote sustainable development through 

the ethical management principles and supplier evaluations, thereby enhancing the 
sustainable value of the company. devote 
resources/
Concrete 
Results

•     Organize internal and external training sessions and awareness programs on integrity 

management topics, including the ethical corporate management best practice 
principles, procedures for ethical management and guidelines for conduct, and the 
management procedures for preventing insider trading. •     Achieve 98% of suppliers with transactions exceeding TWD 100,000 signing the 

"Integrity and Sustainable Development Commitment."

•     The Integrity Management Task Force reports the results to the Board of Directors 

once a year. Grievance 
Mechanism

of directors in May, the new management team recruited several food industry professionals, conducted organizational restructuring,

Organizational Structure

While pursuing maximum profits, Taisun also actively considers how to reduce the negative environmental impact of economic activities 

and expand its influence to implement corporate social responsibility, creating sustainable operational value. In 2023, in the face of global supply chain issues, the prolonged Russia-Ukraine conflict leading to an international energy crisis, and 

significant increases in raw material prices, Taisun implemented flexible supply chain scheduling to reduce negative impacts on business 

operations. In supplier management, in addition to regular supplier evaluations, Taisun continued to implement the signing of the 

“Integrity and Sustainable Development Commitment” by suppliers, ensuring the strictest quality and safety controls for vendors and

methods already under consideration. Once certain projects are completed and operational, it is estimated that Taisun will make

The Chairman serves as the Chief Commissioner of the ESG Sustainability 

Development Committee. Committee members include the General 

Manager, first-level supervisors under the jurisdiction, and the 

spokesperson. They supervise and manage the goals, results, commitments, 

and planning of sustainable operations and social responsibility, fulfilling 

long-term commitments to stakeholders while disclosing information to the 

public and conducting internal audits. The ESG Responsibility Office is responsible for coordinating and 

implementing related ESG strategic goal plans and actions. It regularly holds 

meetings to assist the committee in ensuring various commitments are 

completed on schedule, grasps communication information from relevant 

stakeholders in various departments, and regularly discloses work results. The four major groups-corporate governance, health assurance, 

environmental sustainability, and corporate commitment-all report 

department work overviews through regular management meetings held by 

the Responsibility Office. They regularly report to the ESG Sustainability

30|./esg_report/TAISUN_ENTERPRISE.pdf|Climate	Change	Risks	and	Opportunities

In recent years, extreme weather events have become increasingly frequent, and the crisis of global warming has become more prominent. Additionally, international research reports and governments worldwide are paying more attention to climate change issues. This has led 

to strengthened regulatory measures and legal amendments in various countries to address areas where change is possible, prompting 

businesses to incorporate climate change issues into their operational management. Taisun, besides learning to identify operational risks 

brought about by climate change, also refers to the TCFD (Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures) recommendations 

published by the Financial Stability Board (FSB). The company has incorporated the four core disclosure elements - “Governance,” 

“Strategy,” “Risk Management,” and “Metrics and Targets” - into its operational management. Furthermore, Taisun discloses the impacts 

of climate change-related risks and opportunities, as well as potential response measures, in its sustainability report. Management 
Operation	
Method

1. Governance

②	 Physical	Risk ∣ Immediate

The ESG Sustainable Development Committee is responsible for overseeing climate-related risk 

management and approving climate strategies and targets. Climate-related response measures are 

jointly decided by the ESG Committee and approved by the chief commissioner for implementation. The committee reports to the board of directors annually, with the board monitoring implementation 

effectiveness. In 2023, one report was made to the board regarding significant opportunity and risk 

assessments, including financial risks, product opportunity risks, and carbon fee impacts. 2. Strategy

The company refers to the IPCC’s Sixth Assessment Report (AR6) and the Environmental Protection 

Administration’s goal of limiting temperature rise to 1.5°C. They use the TCCIP (Taiwan Climate 

Change Projection Information and Adaptation Knowledge Platform) tools to assess physical risk 

scenarios. The company has adopted a scenario of limiting global warming to below 2°C for assessing 

physical and regulatory transition risks. ①	 Transition	Risk ∣ Policy and Regulatory Risk

The “Climate Change Response Act” will impose carbon fees on high-emission products with 

direct or indirect emissions starting in 2025, potentially increasing our company’s operational 

costs, although it won’t impact overall operations. Our company completed greenhouse gas 

inventory education and training in 2020 and has introduced management approaches such as 

utility equipment replacement.", "page|source|page_content
16|./esg_report/TAISUN_ENTERPRISE.pdf|•    The company annually announces and promotes information security policies and cultivates 

employees with information security awareness. •    Report to the Information Security Committee at least once a year and summarize the overall 

information security risk situation. •    No incidents impacting company operations or infringing on customer privacy rights occurred 

in 2023. The unit responsible for information security in our company is the “Information Security Management 

Committee,” composed of IT department personnel. It oversees the Information Security Working Group, 

Information Security Audit Group, and Emergency Response Group, coordinating information security-

related policy formulation, implementation, risk management, and compliance audits. The highest supervisor 

of the Information Security Management Committee reports annually to the Board of Directors on 

information security management effectiveness, related issues, and directions. To effectively control information security, the Information Security Committee is responsible for 

formulating information security strategies and ensuring internal compliance with information security-

related guidelines, procedures, and regulations. The Information Security Management Committee holds 

at least one management review meeting annually to review and resolve information security policies and 

implement the effectiveness of information security management measures. The Information Security 

Audit Group conducts an internal audit once a year, and the company’s audit department also performs 

an information security audit annually. If there are deficiencies, they are required to propose relevant 

improvement plans and report to the Board of Directors, with regular follow-ups on improvement 

effectiveness to reduce internal information security risks. 032

response:
The report from Taisun Enterprise outlines a comprehensive approach to integrating Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives with its overall business strategy. This connection is articulated through various governance structures and strategic frameworks designed to ensure that ESG considerations are not only acknowledged but actively pursued in the companys operational management.

At the core of Taisun's approach is the ESG Sustainability Development Committee, which oversees the integration of ESG factors into the company's strategies. This committee is responsible for approving climate strategies, setting targets, and monitoring the effectiveness of ESG initiatives. The report indicates that the committee regularly reports to the board of directors, ensuring that ESG performance is aligned with corporate governance and operational goals. This governance structure signifies a clear commitment to making ESG a pivotal aspect of business strategy, rather than a peripheral concern.

Furthermore, the report describes specific actionable measures that the company has implemented to address ESG-related challenges. For instance, Taisun has undertaken a "TCFD Climate Change-related Financial Disclosure" survey to identify and assess climate-related risks and opportunities. This proactive approach enables the company to anticipate and respond to potential impacts on its operations and financial performance. The inclusion of measurable goals, such as setting targets for carbon emission reductions and water management, demonstrates a clear linkage between ESG initiatives and the company's broader strategic objectives.

Additionally, the report highlights the company's focus on stakeholder engagement, which is crucial for identifying material issues that impact both the business and its ESG commitments. By engaging with stakeholders and incorporating their feedback, Taisun can refine its strategies to better align with market expectations and regulatory requirements. This stakeholder-driven approach further solidifies the connection between ESG initiatives and overall business strategy, ensuring that actions taken are relevant and responsive to both internal and external pressures.

In conclusion, the report effectively articulates how Taisun's ESG initiatives are integrated into its business strategy through established governance structures, actionable measures, and stakeholder engagement. The clear connections made between ESG goals and operational practices suggest that the company is not only committed to sustainability but is also taking concrete steps to embed these principles into its core business operations. This alignment facilitates not just compliance and risk management but also enhances the company's long-term value and resilience in a changing marketplace.
reference:
### **Linking ESG Initiatives to Business Strategy**

The 2023 ESG Sustainability Report of **Taisun Enterprise Co., Ltd.** effectively integrates the companys ESG initiatives with its overarching business strategy. This alignment demonstrates Taisuns commitment to sustainable growth while addressing environmental, social, and governance (ESG) concerns in a structured and actionable manner.

#### **Integration with Business Strategy**

1. **Governance and Operational Stability:**
   - Taisun emphasizes stable governance as a foundation for sustainable business growth. In 2023, the company underwent significant changes, including a complete board re-election and organizational restructuring, aimed at improving operational performance and aligning governance practices with its ESG goals.
   - The establishment of an **ESG Sustainability Development Committee** highlights the integration of ESG oversight into core business operations. This committee collaborates with senior management and reports directly to the Board of Directors, ensuring ESG priorities are embedded in strategic decision-making.

2. **Climate Change and Environmental Management:**
   - The company has launched initiatives such as constructing a natural gas high-pressure pipeline and planning solar panel installations to reduce carbon emissions and enhance energy efficiency. These projects align with the companys broader goal of achieving a leading position in carbon management within the food industry.
   - Taisuns waste management and water conservation strategies, such as achieving a waste recovery rate of 95% and reducing water consumption by 2% over three years, further demonstrate the integration of environmental sustainability into operational practices.

3. **Product Innovation and Market Expansion:**
   - ESG-driven product innovation is a cornerstone of Taisuns business strategy. The company has committed to developing ESG-focused products, such as low-sugar and eco-friendly packaging options, which align with consumer trends and regulatory requirements. By targeting 18% of new products to adhere to ESG concepts, Taisun positions itself competitively in the market while adhering to sustainability principles.
   - Taisun also emphasizes enhancing sales channels, including traditional, modern, and e-commerce platforms, to improve operational efficiency and reach.

4. **Employee and Community Commitment:**
   - Taisuns focus on employee care and community engagement strengthens its internal workforce while building external goodwill. Programs like the Zero Fee for Migrant Workers initiative and achieving the Happy Enterprise award reflect how social initiatives are integrated into the companys human resource strategy.
   - Community-based initiatives, such as sponsoring educational programs and promoting food safety awareness, reinforce Taisuns role as a socially responsible entity.

---

#### **Clarity and Actionability**

1. **Clearly Articulated Goals:**
   - The report outlines specific short-, medium-, and long-term goals for ESG initiatives, such as carbon intensity reduction, employee satisfaction targets, and product innovation milestones. These objectives provide measurable benchmarks that link directly to business outcomes.

2. **Actionable Plans:**
   - Concrete steps, such as upgrading production lines for energy efficiency, expanding renewable energy usage, and enhancing supplier management practices, are detailed in the report. These actions align with the company's financial performance goals by reducing costs and improving operational resilience.

3. **Strategic Integration:**
   - By embedding ESG priorities within its governance structure and operational activities, Taisun ensures that sustainability is not an isolated endeavor but a core component of its business strategy.

---

### **Strengths and Areas for Improvement**

**Strengths:**
   - Comprehensive linkage between ESG initiatives and business strategy.
   - Clearly defined goals and actionable plans for achieving sustainability targets.
   - Integration of ESG oversight into governance structures ensures accountability and alignment with business priorities.

**Areas for Improvement:**
   - The report could benefit from additional quantitative data linking ESG initiatives to financial performance, such as cost savings from energy efficiency projects or revenue growth from ESG-driven products.
   - Enhanced stakeholder feedback on the alignment of ESG goals with market expectations could strengthen the strategic connection.

---

In conclusion, the 2023 ESG Sustainability Report of Taisun Enterprise Co., Ltd. demonstrates a well-articulated and actionable approach to integrating ESG initiatives with its overall business strategy. This alignment not only supports sustainable development but also enhances the companys competitive position and stakeholder trust. Further refinement in quantifying the financial impact of ESG initiatives would add greater depth to the strategic linkage.

31|./esg_report/TAISUN_ENTERPRISE.pdf|3. Risk	Management

In 2022, our company’s ESG Sustainable Development Committee launched a “TCFD Climate Change-related Financial Disclosure” 

survey. They convened relevant members in meetings to jointly assess potential risks the company may face due to climate change, 

identifying risk sources, conducting risk analysis and assessment, and addressing risks to continuously reduce impact. They discussed 

and identified transition risks (policy and regulations, technology, market, reputation), physical risks (immediate risks, long-term risks), 

and opportunities (resource efficiency, energy sources, products/services, market, resilience). Considering the time frame, the assessment 

intervals are short-term (1-3 years), medium-term (3-5 years), and long-term (over 5 years). The top 10 in each interval are prioritized, 

with short-term risks addressed first. Medium and long-term risks are evaluated based on company resources. Annual reviews of 

strategic actions assess the effectiveness of target implementation. If necessary, risk discussions and identification are conducted again.", "page|source|page_content

Materiality Management Identification Process

Identification 
Process

The compilation of the 2023 ESG Sustainability Report, based on stakeholder inclusiveness, 

responsiveness, impact, and sustainability perspectives, identified seven major stakeholders, same as 

the previous ESG Sustainability Report. Additionally, 25 issues were identified based on food industry-related regulations. After interacting 

with stakeholders and discussions with the ESG Sustainability Development Committee and experts 

about positive, negative, and actual potential impacts (recorded in meeting minutes), 11 material issues 

were analyzed for this year’s report. These serve as the focus of the 2023 report, with other issues 

voluntarily disclosed based on key food industry situations. The report will explain the management 

approach and related disclosure items for each material topic. ESG Work Strategy

Ethical Management

Importance to 
the Company

Establishing a corporate culture of integrity management helps the company’s healthy 
development, consolidates a good business operational framework, and protects the 
rights and interests of all stakeholders. Policy 
Commitment

Short-Term 
Goals

The Board of Directors has approved the “Ethical Corporate Management Best Practice 
Principles” and the “Procedures for Ethical Development and Guidelines for Conduct,” 
which are implemented by all Board members and employees. The company is committed 
to operating all business activities with integrity management principles, striving for the 
best operational performance. •      Ensure 100% of new suppliers with transactions exceeding TWD 100,000 sign the 

"Integrity and Sustainable Development Commitment."

•     Continue to conduct educational training and awareness programs for all Board 

members and employees regarding relevant laws and regulations. •     Enhance information transparency. Mid-and Long-
Term Goals

•     Expand corporate influence and continue to promote sustainable development through 

the ethical management principles and supplier evaluations, thereby enhancing the 
sustainable value of the company. devote 
resources/

Results

•     Organize internal and external training sessions and awareness programs on integrity 

management topics, including the ethical corporate management best practice 
principles, procedures for ethical management and guidelines for conduct, and the 
management procedures for preventing insider trading. •     Achieve 98% of suppliers with transactions exceeding TWD 100,000 signing the 

"Integrity and Sustainable Development Commitment."

•     The Integrity Management Task Force reports the results to the Board of Directors 

once a year. Grievance

response:
The 2023 ESG Sustainability Report from Taisun Enterprise does not explicitly provide historical comparative data in a detailed manner. However, it does mention that updates to information from previous reports are explained in relevant sections, suggesting some level of continuity and tracking of changes over time. The report outlines various aspects of ESG performance, such as governance structures, risk management strategies, and sustainability initiatives, which can imply a framework for assessing progress.

In terms of transparency, the report emphasizes that it has been reviewed and approved by the ESG Sustainability Development Committee and subsequently submitted for limited assurance procedures by Ernst & Young. This indicates a level of external oversight and validation, which can enhance the credibility of the reported data. Furthermore, the mention of specific goals, actions, and stakeholder engagement processes suggests an intention to provide a clear narrative around Taisun's ESG strategy and its evolution.

While the report highlights various metrics and targets, such as those related to greenhouse gas emissions, water management, and ethical supplier practices, it does not present a comprehensive historical performance analysis that explicitly compares current data to past results. Instead, it focuses on outlining current practices and future goals without detailed historical benchmarks. Thus, while there is some indication of tracking and accountability, the absence of explicit comparative data makes it challenging to assess the meaningfulness of the trends presented. Overall, the report aims for transparency through its governance and engagement processes, yet it could benefit from more robust historical data comparisons to better illustrate progress over time.
reference:
### **Comparisons of Current ESG Performance with Historical Data**

The 2023 ESG Sustainability Report of **Taisun Enterprise Co., Ltd.** incorporates comparisons of current ESG performance with historical data to illustrate progress and trends. These comparisons are structured across various ESG dimensions, offering stakeholders a transparent view of the companys sustainability journey. Below is an evaluation of these comparisons and their meaningfulness.

#### **Historical Comparisons**

1. **Environmental Performance:**
   - **Waste Recovery Rate:** The report highlights a waste recovery rate of **95%**, reflecting Taisuns commitment to minimizing environmental impact. However, specific year-on-year comparisons to prior recovery rates are not detailed, which could limit the ability to assess improvement trends quantitatively.
   - **Water Conservation:** A target to reduce water consumption by **2% over three years** is stated, but the report lacks a direct historical comparison to previous years water usage, making it difficult to gauge progress within the reporting period.

2. **Carbon Emissions and Energy Management:**
   - Taisun reports plans for installing solar panels and transitioning from oil-fired to natural gas boilers, which are part of its strategy to enhance renewable energy use. While these initiatives indicate forward momentum, the report does not include specific historical carbon emission data for comparison, which limits the transparency of trends.

3. **Financial and Operational Metrics:**
   - **Revenue Trends:** The report provides a detailed year-on-year comparison of revenue, showing an increase of **1.12% in 2023** compared to 2022. Historical data for 2021, 2022, and 2023 is presented in tabular format, offering transparency in financial performance.
   - **Employee Remuneration:** The total remuneration for employees is provided for 2023, but historical data on remuneration levels or trends is not included.

4. **Corporate Governance Metrics:**
   - The report notes a decline in the corporate governance evaluation ranking in 2023 due to governance issues, compared to stronger performance in earlier years. However, quantitative data to highlight specific changes in evaluation scores over time is not provided.

5. **Social Performance:**
   - **Employee Satisfaction:** A satisfaction rate of **67.31%** is reported for 2023, but the absence of historical satisfaction rates limits insights into whether this reflects an improvement or a decline.
   - **Zero Fee for Migrant Workers Initiative:** Although the initiative is highlighted as a key milestone, there is no comparison to previous years regarding the treatment or satisfaction of migrant workers.

---

#### **Meaningfulness and Transparency of Comparisons**

1. **Strengths:**
   - The financial data, such as revenue and net profit trends, is transparently disclosed with clear year-on-year comparisons.
   - The report includes measurable ESG targets, such as waste recovery and water reduction, that provide a basis for future comparisons.

2. **Areas for Improvement:**
   - While progress on some initiatives is discussed qualitatively, the report would benefit from more quantitative comparisons of environmental and social performance metrics over multiple years.
   - Historical benchmarks for key metrics like carbon emissions, water usage, employee satisfaction, and waste recovery rates would enhance the ability to evaluate trends and progress.

---

### **Evaluation of Comparisons**

The 2023 report partially succeeds in providing meaningful comparisons, particularly in financial performance. However, the lack of consistent historical data for many environmental and social indicators limits the transparency and impact of these comparisons. Incorporating detailed, year-over-year metrics for critical ESG dimensions would strengthen the reports ability to demonstrate Taisuns progress and reinforce its accountability to stakeholders.

In conclusion, while the report makes commendable efforts to outline performance in 2023, enhancing historical comparisons across all ESG dimensions would provide a clearer and more actionable view of Taisun Enterprise's sustainability progress over time.

In 2022, our company’s ESG Sustainable Development Committee launched a “TCFD Climate Change-related Financial Disclosure” 

survey. They convened relevant members in meetings to jointly assess potential risks the company may face due to climate change, 

identifying risk sources, conducting risk analysis and assessment, and addressing risks to continuously reduce impact. They discussed 

and identified transition risks (policy and regulations, technology, market, reputation), physical risks (immediate risks, long-term risks), 

and opportunities (resource efficiency, energy sources, products/services, market, resilience). Considering the time frame, the assessment 

intervals are short-term (1-3 years), medium-term (3-5 years), and long-term (over 5 years). The top 10 in each interval are prioritized, 

with short-term risks addressed first. Medium and long-term risks are evaluated based on company resources. Annual reviews of 

strategic actions assess the effectiveness of target implementation. If necessary, risk discussions and identification are conducted again.", "page|source|page_content

response:
The report from Taisun Enterprise does not provide specific quantifiable data on the company's carbon emissions, including detailed metrics for Scope 1, Scope 2, and Scope 3 emissions. It mentions that the company conducts an annual internal greenhouse gas (GHG) emission inventory in accordance with ISO 14064-1:2018, but it has not yet met the timeline required for conducting greenhouse gas inventory and assurance. Therefore, there is currently no available information on assurance scope, assurance body, or assurance opinion for these emissions.

The report also indicates that third-party verification of the GHG emissions inventory is scheduled for 2026. This means that while the company is in the process of tracking its emissions, the data has not yet undergone external validation. Consequently, stakeholders looking for verified emission metrics, particularly for Scope 1, Scope 2, and Scope 3, will need to wait until the company completes its planned verification process in the upcoming years.
reference:
### **Carbon Emissions Data in the ESG Report**

The 2023 ESG Sustainability Report of **Taisun Enterprise Co., Ltd.** includes an overview of the companys initiatives related to carbon management and emission reductions. However, upon review, the report does not provide detailed, quantifiable data specifically on Scope 1, Scope 2, or Scope 3 carbon emissions. Below is an analysis based on the report's contents.

#### **Carbon Management Efforts**

1. **Emission Reduction Initiatives:**
   - Taisun reports on its commitment to energy conservation and carbon reduction by adopting measures such as:
     - The construction of a natural gas high-pressure pipeline to replace oil-fired boilers with natural gas boilers, which is expected to significantly reduce emissions once operational.
     - The evaluation of solar panel installations in the Tianzhong area to increase the use of renewable energy.
   - These initiatives align with the companys broader goal to reduce its carbon intensity by more than 10% and become a leader in carbon management within its industry.

2. **Targets and Goals:**
   - The report mentions a commitment to reducing carbon emissions intensity but does not provide baseline data or specific metrics for comparison. This limits the ability to track progress quantitatively over time.

---

#### **Quantifiable Carbon Emission Data**

1. **Scope 1 and Scope 2 Emissions:**
   - The report does not explicitly disclose quantified data for Scope 1 (direct emissions from owned or controlled sources) or Scope 2 (indirect emissions from purchased energy) emissions. While the company outlines measures to address these areas, such as the transition to natural gas boilers, the absence of specific metrics diminishes the transparency of its carbon footprint.

2. **Scope 3 Emissions:**
   - Scope 3 emissions, which include indirect emissions throughout the value chain (e.g., supply chain and product lifecycle), are not mentioned in the report. This omission represents a gap in the companys reporting framework and could hinder comprehensive sustainability assessments.

---

#### **Third-party Verification**

The report does not state whether Taisuns carbon emissions data, if collected, is verified by third parties. It does, however, mention that the overall ESG report is reviewed and verified by Ernst & Young for limited assurance under Assurance Standard No. 3000. This general verification adds credibility but does not specifically address carbon emissions metrics.

---

### **Evaluation and Recommendations**

1. **Strengths:**
   - Taisun demonstrates a clear commitment to reducing emissions through specific initiatives like transitioning to natural gas and exploring renewable energy options.
   - The report highlights medium- and long-term goals for carbon intensity reduction, indicating a strategic focus on sustainability.

2. **Areas for Improvement:**
   - The report lacks detailed and quantified disclosures for Scope 1, Scope 2, and Scope 3 emissions. Incorporating this data would significantly enhance transparency and accountability.
   - Third-party verification of emissions data should be explicitly addressed to bolster credibility and stakeholder confidence.
   - Setting baselines and interim targets for carbon reduction efforts would provide a clearer framework for tracking progress.

---

### **Conclusion**

The 2023 ESG Sustainability Report of Taisun Enterprise demonstrates the companys awareness of the importance of carbon management but falls short in providing detailed and quantifiable emissions data. Including Scope 1, Scope 2, and Scope 3 emissions metrics, supported by third-party verification, would enhance the reports transparency and enable stakeholders to better assess Taisuns progress toward its carbon reduction goals.

response:
The report from Taisun Enterprise outlines its approaches to emissions reduction, but it does not explicitly state that the targets are science-based. The company follows ISO 14064-1:2018 guidelines for its annual greenhouse gas emission inventories and plans for third-party verification in 2026. This indicates a commitment to structured emissions tracking and management but does not confirm that the targets align with science-based standards.

Regarding milestones and deadlines, the report does mention specific targets for reducing water usage and wastewater management, aiming to increase the rate of ranch wastewater irrigation for napier grass to 10% by 2026, with a successful achievement of a 5% target in 2023. However, while there are timelines for these specific goals, the report lacks detailed milestones or intermediate targets specifically for greenhouse gas emissions reduction. 

To summarize, while Taisun Enterprise has set certain targets and timelines, the absence of explicit mention of science-based targets and detailed milestones for emissions reduction suggests that further clarity and commitment are needed in this area.
reference:
### **Emission Reduction Targets: Science-based Analysis**

The 2023 ESG Sustainability Report of **Taisun Enterprise Co., Ltd.** outlines the companys commitment to reducing carbon emissions and integrating sustainable practices into its operations. However, based on the information provided in the report, it is unclear whether the emission reduction targets are explicitly **science-based**, as defined by frameworks such as the Science-Based Targets initiative (SBTi). Below is an evaluation of the emission reduction targets, their alignment with science-based criteria, and the inclusion of milestones and deadlines.

---

#### **Analysis of Emission Reduction Targets**

1. **Emission Reduction Goals:**
   - Taisun sets a goal to reduce carbon emission intensity by more than **10%** over an unspecified baseline period. The company also aims to become an industry leader in carbon management.
   - Specific initiatives include transitioning from oil-fired boilers to natural gas boilers and evaluating the installation of solar panels to increase renewable energy adoption.

2. **Science-based Criteria:**
   - While the report demonstrates a commitment to carbon reduction, it does not specify whether the targets are aligned with scientific methodologies, such as limiting global temperature rise to 1.5C or 2C, as advocated by the Paris Agreement.
   - The absence of a clear baseline year or quantitative Scope 1, Scope 2, or Scope 3 emissions data further limits the ability to assess whether these targets meet science-based criteria.

3. **Milestones and Deadlines:**
   - The report lacks defined interim milestones or deadlines for achieving the 10% reduction in carbon emission intensity. This makes it challenging to track progress effectively or evaluate the companys alignment with long-term sustainability goals.
   - There is no explicit mention of how frequently Taisun plans to review or adjust its targets based on evolving climate science or operational performance.

---

#### **Strengths in Emission Reduction Initiatives**

1. **Practical Measures:**
   - The planned replacement of oil-fired boilers with natural gas boilers demonstrates actionable steps toward reducing direct emissions.
   - The exploration of solar energy options reflects an interest in transitioning to renewable energy sources.

2. **Commitment to Continuous Improvement:**
   - Taisuns broader sustainability goals, such as achieving a 95% waste recovery rate and implementing energy-saving measures in production, complement its carbon reduction initiatives.

---

#### **Areas for Improvement**

1. **Lack of Science-based Validation:**
   - The report does not provide evidence that its emission reduction targets are validated by external standards, such as the Science-Based Targets initiative (SBTi). This could raise questions about the sufficiency of its goals in addressing global climate change.

2. **Absence of Milestones:**
   - The report does not include interim milestones or specific deadlines, which limits the ability of stakeholders to monitor and evaluate progress.

3. **Baseline and Scope Details:**
   - A clearly defined baseline year, along with Scope 1, Scope 2, and Scope 3 emission data, is essential for meaningful assessment and tracking of progress.

---

### **Recommendations**

To enhance the credibility and effectiveness of its emission reduction strategy, Taisun should consider the following:

1. **Adopt Science-based Targets:**
   - Align targets with SBTi or similar frameworks to ensure they are grounded in climate science and contribute to global efforts to mitigate climate change.

2. **Define Milestones and Deadlines:**
   - Establish clear interim milestones and deadlines to track progress. For instance, set annual or bi-annual review points to evaluate the achievement of the 10% carbon reduction goal.

3. **Disclose Comprehensive Emission Data:**
   - Provide detailed Scope 1, Scope 2, and Scope 3 emission data, along with a defined baseline year, to enable accurate tracking and comparison over time.

4. **External Verification:**
   - Seek third-party validation for emission reduction targets and progress to enhance stakeholder confidence in the companys sustainability efforts.

---

### **Conclusion**

While Taisun Enterprise demonstrates a clear commitment to reducing emissions and has implemented practical initiatives to support this goal, the absence of science-based targets, defined milestones, and detailed emissions data diminishes the transparency and robustness of its strategy. Aligning its targets with science-based frameworks and incorporating measurable milestones will significantly strengthen the companys position as a leader in sustainable carbon management.

response:
The report provides a detailed overview of energy usage and efficiency within the company's operations, highlighting changes in energy consumption and the shift towards renewable energy sources over recent years.

In terms of total energy consumption, the report indicates that there were fluctuations in energy usage across different years. For example, the total energy consumption was 14,424.31 GJ in 2021, increased to 14,863.19 GJ in 2022, and then decreased to 14,301.65 GJ in 2023. This indicates a slight overall decline when comparing the latest figures to those from two years prior. The average energy consumption per ton of production also saw changes, with an increase from 0.67 GJ/ton in 2021 to 0.80 GJ/ton in 2023, reflecting a rise in energy intensity despite efforts to improve efficiency.

Regarding renewable energy, the report outlines the percentage of energy derived from renewable sources. In 2023, renewable energy usage was reported at 55.26% of total energy consumption. This figure shows a significant commitment to renewable energy, especially as the percentage of purchased electricity increased slightly from 42.33% in 2021 to 43.58% in 2022, before dropping to 40.28% in 2023. The company has also made plans to invest in transitioning from oil-fired boilers to natural gas boilers in 2024, which is expected to further reduce carbon emissions and enhance energy efficiency.

Overall, the report reflects a proactive approach to managing energy consumption through various measures, including regular monitoring of energy usage, replacing outdated machinery, and implementing process improvements. The company's goal to increase renewable energy usage and reduce reliance on non-renewable sources is evident, as is its commitment to continuous improvement in energy efficiency practices.
reference:
### **Energy Usage and Efficiency**

The 2023 ESG Sustainability Report of **Taisun Enterprise Co., Ltd.** provides insights into the companys energy usage and efforts to improve energy efficiency. The report outlines specific initiatives to enhance energy efficiency and transition toward renewable energy, although it lacks detailed disclosures regarding the percentage of energy derived from renewable sources or progress compared to previous years.

---

#### **Energy Usage Initiatives**

1. **Transition to Natural Gas:**
   - Taisun initiated the construction of a **natural gas high-pressure pipeline** for its food factory. Upon completion, natural gas boilers will replace oil-fired boilers, resulting in increased energy efficiency and reduced environmental impact.

2. **Exploration of Renewable Energy:**
   - The company is actively evaluating the installation of **solar panels** in the Tianzhong area. Planning for suitable locations and methods is underway, signaling a shift toward renewable energy adoption.

3. **Energy Conservation Measures:**
   - Taisun highlights ongoing efforts to improve energy efficiency in its production processes, including upgrading equipment and implementing energy-saving measures. These initiatives are part of the companys broader goal to reduce carbon intensity.

---

#### **Renewable Energy and Progress Over Time**

1. **Renewable Energy Percentage:**
   - The report does not disclose the current percentage of energy derived from renewable sources or any specific renewable energy targets. While the evaluation of solar panel installations reflects an intention to transition to renewables, there is no quantifiable data provided to measure the companys reliance on renewable energy.

2. **Year-over-Year Comparisons:**
   - The report does not provide historical data or year-over-year comparisons of energy usage or renewable energy adoption. This omission makes it difficult to assess Taisuns progress in energy efficiency or its transition to renewable energy over time.

---

#### **Strengths in Energy Strategy**

1. **Commitment to Energy Transition:**
   - Taisun demonstrates a proactive approach to improving energy efficiency and adopting cleaner energy sources through its natural gas pipeline project and renewable energy evaluations.

2. **Alignment with Sustainability Goals:**
   - The energy conservation measures align with the companys broader sustainability objectives, including carbon intensity reduction and environmental impact mitigation.

---

#### **Areas for Improvement**

1. **Quantifiable Data:**
   - The report would benefit from disclosing specific energy usage metrics, such as total energy consumption, energy intensity per production unit, and the percentage of energy from renewable sources.

2. **Tracking Progress:**
   - Including year-over-year comparisons of energy usage and renewable energy adoption would provide stakeholders with a clearer picture of Taisuns progress in energy management.

3. **Renewable Energy Targets:**
   - Setting measurable targets for renewable energy adoption and reporting progress against these targets would enhance transparency and accountability.

---

### **Recommendations**

To strengthen its energy-related disclosures, Taisun should consider the following:

1. **Detailed Energy Metrics:**
   - Provide data on total energy consumption, energy intensity, and the proportion of energy derived from renewable sources.

2. **Historical Comparisons:**
   - Include year-over-year data to highlight progress in energy efficiency and renewable energy adoption.

3. **Renewable Energy Goals:**
   - Establish clear, science-based renewable energy targets and report on milestones to track progress effectively.

4. **Third-party Verification:**
   - Obtain external assurance for energy-related disclosures to enhance credibility and stakeholder trust.

---

### **Conclusion**

While the 2023 ESG Sustainability Report of Taisun Enterprise outlines commendable initiatives to improve energy efficiency and explore renewable energy options, it lacks detailed metrics and historical data to fully evaluate its energy performance. Incorporating quantitative disclosures and progress tracking would significantly enhance the reports transparency and provide a clearer understanding of Taisuns commitment to sustainable energy management.

response:
The report provides a comprehensive overview of water resource management within Taisun Enterprises, highlighting its importance in their operational processes. In 2023, Taisun reported a total water intake of 744.76 tons, with total wastewater discharge amounting to 397.88 tons and water consumption at 346.88 tons. Notably, compared to the previous year, there was a decrease in water intake by 17.44 tons and a reduction in wastewater discharge by 72.77 tons, indicating a proactive approach towards minimizing water usage.

In terms of recycling, Taisun has implemented water recycling policies that led to a 2% reduction in water withdrawal in 2023, with a target set for a 5% reduction by 2026. The company has established water recycling and reuse facilities across its production lines, which are expected to significantly improve water conservation efficiency. Additionally, new factory buildings are being equipped with water resource recycling systems aimed at further reducing consumption, with a notable goal of increasing the rate of ranch wastewater irrigation for napier grass to 10% by 2026.

The report emphasizes Taisun's commitment to effective water management, detailing the processes in place for monitoring and maintaining water quality. This includes daily checks of pH and residual chlorine levels, as well as monthly microbiological tests. Furthermore, the company acknowledges the challenges posed by climate change, such as erratic rainfall patterns and water quality issues, and is actively seeking to address these through improved operational practices and infrastructure investments. Overall, Taisun's strategies reflect a strong commitment to sustainable water resource management and continuous improvement in water usage practices.
reference:
### **Water Resource Management in the ESG Report**

The 2023 ESG Sustainability Report of **Taisun Enterprise Co., Ltd.** highlights the companys approach to water resource management as part of its commitment to environmental sustainability. The report outlines measures aimed at reducing water consumption and improving water resource efficiency. However, it lacks detailed data on water usage and recycling rates, limiting the ability to assess quantitative progress.

---

#### **Water Usage and Reduction Measures**

1. **Reduction Targets:**
   - Taisun has set a goal to reduce water consumption by **2% over three years**. This target reflects the companys recognition of water resource management as a critical aspect of its sustainability strategy.

2. **Operational Efficiency:**
   - The report emphasizes efforts to improve operational efficiency to minimize water usage, particularly in manufacturing processes. Specific strategies or technologies employed to achieve this reduction, however, are not detailed.

---

#### **Water Recycling and Reuse**

1. **Recycling Rates:**
   - The report does not include quantifiable data on the percentage of water recycled or reused within the companys operations. While water conservation is identified as a priority, the lack of specific metrics limits transparency in evaluating Taisuns recycling efforts.

2. **Wastewater Management:**
   - Taisun mentions the management of wastewater as part of its broader environmental responsibility but does not provide detailed data on wastewater treatment processes, discharge volumes, or compliance with regulatory standards.

---

#### **Progress and Historical Comparisons**

1. **Year-over-Year Comparisons:**
   - The report does not provide historical data on water usage or recycling rates, making it challenging to track progress against the stated reduction target.

2. **Measurement and Monitoring:**
   - Although Taisun identifies water resource management as a material topic, the absence of monitoring frameworks or progress reports diminishes the ability to evaluate performance over time.

---

### **Strengths in Water Resource Management**

1. **Acknowledgment of Materiality:**
   - By including water resource management as part of its environmental goals, Taisun demonstrates awareness of its responsibility to conserve this critical resource.

2. **Commitment to Reduction:**
   - The 2% water reduction target over three years establishes a clear objective for improvement in resource efficiency.

---

### **Areas for Improvement**

1. **Detailed Metrics:**
   - The report should disclose total water usage, recycling rates, and wastewater discharge volumes to provide a comprehensive understanding of its water resource impact.

2. **Progress Tracking:**
   - Including year-over-year comparisons and progress updates on reduction targets would enhance transparency and accountability.

3. **Recycling Initiatives:**
   - Detailed information on water recycling or reuse initiatives, including specific technologies or systems implemented, would strengthen the companys water management disclosures.

4. **Compliance Data:**
   - Information on compliance with water quality standards or regulatory requirements would demonstrate the companys commitment to sustainable water practices.

---

### **Recommendations**

To enhance its reporting on water resource management, Taisun should consider the following:

1. **Quantify Water Usage:**
   - Provide data on total water consumption, broken down by operational activities, to enable stakeholders to assess water efficiency.

2. **Track and Report Recycling:**
   - Disclose the percentage of water recycled or reused, along with initiatives to improve recycling rates.

3. **Establish Monitoring Frameworks:**
   - Implement robust monitoring systems to track water usage, recycling, and discharge, with periodic updates on progress toward reduction targets.

4. **Enhance Transparency:**
   - Include compliance data related to wastewater treatment and discharge standards to validate the companys adherence to environmental regulations.

---

### **Conclusion**

Taisun Enterprises 2023 ESG Sustainability Report highlights a commitment to water resource management through reduction targets and efficiency improvements. However, the lack of detailed metrics and progress tracking diminishes the ability to evaluate its performance comprehensively. Incorporating quantitative data and year-over-year comparisons would significantly enhance transparency and stakeholder confidence in Taisuns water management efforts.

Company has invested significant resources in environmental indicators, 
requiring suppliers to cooperate with energy-saving and carbon-

In 2023, the food factory produced a total of 1,442 tons of resource-type waste, with a 
recycling rate target of 95%, achieving an actual rate of 95.99%. Taisun actively implements three main goals for waste management: “Minimize waste production, 

maximize resource recycling, and optimize Supplier Management.” Through production process control 

and operational improvements, the company reduces in-plant waste while also reducing waste treatment 

costs. The entire plant operates on the principle that “reduction is better than treatment, and source 

control is better than recycling.” Annual audits of contracted vendors and transportation management 

are conducted to ensure legal waste handling and prevent illegal dumping. The company takes 

responsibility for waste collection, treatment, and flow management, tracking vendors’ implementation 

of waste treatment and resource recycling. This is reported to the ESG Sustainability Development 

Committee, with the industrial waste management plan serving as the main tracking mechanism. Food Factory 
Management 
Results

•   In 2023, there were 4 identified types of waste handled by contracted vendors. A tracking 

responsibility survey of their waste management was conducted, with 6 inspections and 3 

transportation follow-ups conducted and with all meeting regulatory requirements. These are 

included in the waste vendor selection list.", "page|source|page_content

Corporate GovernanceHealth and SafetySustainable EnvironmentCorporate CommitmentOverviewAppendixTaiSun Sustainability Report 2023 ", "page|source|page_content
31|./esg_report/TAISUN_ENTERPRISE.pdf|3. Risk	Management

In 2022, our company’s ESG Sustainable Development Committee launched a “TCFD Climate Change-related Financial Disclosure” 

survey. They convened relevant members in meetings to jointly assess potential risks the company may face due to climate change, 

identifying risk sources, conducting risk analysis and assessment, and addressing risks to continuously reduce impact. They discussed 

and identified transition risks (policy and regulations, technology, market, reputation), physical risks (immediate risks, long-term risks), 

and opportunities (resource efficiency, energy sources, products/services, market, resilience). Considering the time frame, the assessment 

intervals are short-term (1-3 years), medium-term (3-5 years), and long-term (over 5 years). The top 10 in each interval are prioritized, 

with short-term risks addressed first. Medium and long-term risks are evaluated based on company resources. Annual reviews of 

strategic actions assess the effectiveness of target implementation. If necessary, risk discussions and identification are conducted again.", "page|source|page_content
30|./esg_report/TAISUN_ENTERPRISE.pdf|Moreover, extreme climate affects raw material procurement, upstream and downstream 

transportation interruptions, and personnel safety. We expect this situation to lead to short-

term cost increases in various areas. Our company uses diverse procurement channel cooperation, 

combined order transportation, transportation route consolidation, and alternative subcontracting 

to achieve carbon reduction and avoid product and human resource losses. ③	 Resource	Efficiency	Opportunities

In addition to complying with government water resource conservation policies, our company has 

begun to inquire about water recycling system planning. However, due to equipment system and 

recycling site factors, the Sustainable Development Committee currently has no optimal solution 

after evaluation. We expect this case may increase operational costs financially, but in the long run, 

it’s still an effective solution that is environmentally friendly and gradually reduces clean raw water 

extraction. 060

061

In 2023, the total water intake was 744.76 tons, total wastewater discharge 
was 397.88 tons, and total water consumption was 346.88 tons. Compared 
to the previous year, the water intake decreased by 17.44 tons, and 
wastewater discharge decreased by 72.77 tons. Water Resources 
Management and 
Wastewater Discharge

69-71

In 2023, Taisun employed 7 individuals from minority groups (such as 
Taiwan’s indigenous people) and 11 individuals with disabilities. We firmly 
believe that everyone should have equal opportunities and are committed 
to reducing employment barriers for disadvantaged groups, thereby 
ensuring that their economic livelihoods are secured. Management Action for 
Building Market 
Position 2.Diverse and 
Equal Employment

Taisun has established and published the “Taisun Declaration of Human 
Rights Protection” which ensures a healthy and safe working environment, 
prohibits unlawful discrimination, ensures equal employment opportunities, 
prohibits the use of child labor, bans forced labor, prohibits illegal 
infringement, respects privacy, and fosters harmonious labor-management 
communication. Multiple 
Communication 
Channels and Human 
Rights Protection

environment. Occupational Safety 
Hazard Prevention and

Materiality Management Identification Process

Identification 
Process

The compilation of the 2023 ESG Sustainability Report, based on stakeholder inclusiveness, 

responsiveness, impact, and sustainability perspectives, identified seven major stakeholders, same as 

the previous ESG Sustainability Report. Additionally, 25 issues were identified based on food industry-related regulations. After interacting 

with stakeholders and discussions with the ESG Sustainability Development Committee and experts 

about positive, negative, and actual potential impacts (recorded in meeting minutes), 11 material issues 

were analyzed for this year’s report. These serve as the focus of the 2023 report, with other issues 

voluntarily disclosed based on key food industry situations. The report will explain the management 

approach and related disclosure items for each material topic. ESG Work Strategy
